thread.title: Goodell, owners expect future vote on LA relocation
thread.title_full: Goodell, owners expect future vote on LA relocation

author: BARRY WILNER
title: Goodell, owners expect future vote on LA relocation
text:
Richard Drew Goodell, owners expect future vote on LA relocation 
NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell, left, arrives during the National Football League owners meeting, in New York, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015. The owners will further consider the desire of three franchises — the St. Louis Rams, Oakland Raiders and San Diego Chargers — to move to Los Angeles. (AP Photo/Richard Drew) Richard Drew Goodell, owners expect future vote on LA relocation 
New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft walks in a hallway during a break of the National Football League owners meeting, in New York, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015. The owners are considering the desire of three franchises — the St. Louis Rams, Oakland Raiders and San Diego Chargers — to move to Los Angeles. (AP Photo/Richard Drew) Richard Drew Goodell, owners expect future vote on LA relocation 
Dallas Cowboys owner Jerry Jones, and his daughter Charlotte Jones, confer during a break of the National Football League owners meeting, in New York, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015. The owners are considering the desire of three franchises — the St. Louis Rams, Oakland Raiders and San Diego Chargers — to move to Los Angeles.(AP Photo/Richard Drew) Eduardo Verdugo Goodell, owners expect future vote on LA relocation 
FILE - In this Oct. 2, 2005 file photo, a fan wearing a sombrero blows a horn outside of the Azteca Stadium in Mexico City, Mexico, before the start of the first regular-season NFL game between the Arizona Cardinals and 49ers. On Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015, NFL owners approved more international games through 2025, including ones in places other than England, like Mexico and Germany. (AP Photo/Eduardo Verdugo, File) Richard Drew Goodell, owners expect future vote on LA relocation 
NFL Vice President International Mark Waller talks with reporters at the National Football League owners meeting, in New York, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015. The league's owners approved more international games through 2025 on Wednesday, including ones in places other than England — possibly Mexico, Germany and Canada.(AP Photo/Richard Drew) Richard Drew Goodell, owners expect future vote on LA relocation 
St. Louis Rams owner Stan Kroenke walks in the hallway during a break of National Football League owners meeting, in New York, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015. The proposed riverfront stadium in St. Louis has a naming rights deal worth $158 million that hinges on the city having an NFL team when the facility opens. (AP Photo/Richard Drew) Posted: Wednesday, October 7, 2015 7:07 pm | Updated: 7:30 pm, Wed Oct 7, 2015. 
NEW YORK (AP) — NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell expects owners will vote on franchise relocation to Los Angeles.
